name: sfchronicle
text:
The words "Black Lives Matter" now span three blocks of Fulton Street. More than 100 people from different San Francisco community groups joined in on a mural movement inspired by the recent protests across the country over racism and police brutality.

text: Update: The #GrantFire burning east of Sacramento has grown to 4,500 acres and is 30% contained, according to Cal Fire. See the numbers as they update on our Fire Tracker: https://t.co/1m5solcjls https://t.co/VeslJPoL4Y

text: Health officials reported five new cases of the coronavirus in Napa County on Friday, bringing the county‚Äôs total to 168 cases and three deaths. https://t.co/PgrOHVuDBd

text: After three decades, two tax measures, eight years of construction, and two years of delays, BART is (finally) on its way to San Jose. https://t.co/iQQQxCSq8F

name: sfchronicle
text:
Q: How risky is it to get a haircut? 

A: The risk of going to a hair salon or barbershop varies by circumstance: How many people are in the room? How large is the space? How long will you be there?

Read more: https://t.co/C43Yknfr4i https://t.co/zH6eaEhSLt

text: Roughly 45% of police use-of-force incidents in S.F. last year involved black people, Chronicle review finds. https://t.co/bsVQ92PBGn https://t.co/qmkLRc2XYS

name: sfchronicle
text: Mayor Sam Liccardo said in a video statement that San Jose‚Äôs department is ‚Äúalready defunded." There are 1.3 police officers per 1,000 residents, he said, adding "we don‚Äôt believe police are the entity that should be responding to every social problem.‚Äù https://t.co/euEg3c3Tn0

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
A 5,042-acre vegetation fire in Sacramento County was 60% contained as of Friday evening, officials said. There were no reported injuries or structures damaged in the blaze that broke out Friday northeast of Elk Grove, Cal Fire officials said.

https://t.co/nOG7ziUHBO

name: sfchronicle
text:
What do chefs who make the best food in the country keep on their shelves? A new book explores what at least two prominent Bay Area chefs are having for dinner.

https://t.co/eNAuziRPWX

name: sfchronicle
text: Tables 6 feet apart. No salt shaker at your table. Here's what the Bay Area's dining scene might look like, post-shelter-in-place: https://t.co/tct0mIkVvF

name: sfchronicle
text:
Coachella, Stagecoach, Lollapalooza and several other music festivals were canceled last week, as health officials expressed concern about a possible surge in coronavirus cases in the fall. Where does that leave the Bay Area festival season?
https://t.co/gTDju33RcA

name: sfchronicle
text:
Facing a wave of criticism for holding a rally on Juneteenth in Tulsa, President Trump announced he would reschedule the event. The Juneteenth holiday celebrates the emancipation of the last group of enslaved people in Texas. 

For protest updates: https://t.co/17ikz5VLNv https://t.co/Y7JeE5duhp
